member.name: T:Insight.Database.CachedDbDataReader
member.summary: Reads a data stream, caching the fields for a single record at a time. This allows you to convert a sequential read into a random read over a single record.
member.remarks: Disposing this reader does not dispose the inner reader.

member.summary: Reads an object list as a data reader. Not intended to be used directly from object code.

member.name: T:Insight.Database.CodeGenerator.StaticFieldStorage
member.summary: Allows storage of a static variable in a way that can be easily emitted into IL.
member.remarks: We store the information in the static fields of a class because it is easy to access them in the IL of a DynamicMethod.

member.summary: Asynchronously executes the specified query and merges the results into the specified existing object. This is commonly used to retrieve identity values from the database upon an insert. The result set is expected to contain one record that is merged into the object upon return.

The behavior of the command when executed.
The transaction to participate in it.

An optional additional object to output parameters onto.
member.returns: A task whose completion is the object after merging the results.

The number of columns to read.

The index of the first column to read.
The number of columns to read.

True if this object is the root object and should always be created.
True if the columns should be allowed to bind to children.
member.returns: If createNewObject=true, then Func<IDataReader, T>.

member.name: T:Insight.Database.MergeOutputAttribute
member.summary: Marks a method as an Insert/Update/Upsert method so Insight will merge the outputs onto the input objects.
member.remarks: Normally when Insight auto-implements an interface, it only merges the results of methods whose names start with Insert or Update. If you want a method of a different name to automatically merge the results, add the MergeOutput attribute to the method.
